metadata.title: CVE-2019-6991 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A classic Stack-based buffer overflow exists in the zmLoadUser() function in zm_user.cpp of the zmu binary in ZoneMinder through 1.32.3, allowing an unauthenticated attacker to execute code via a long username.

notes.note: seth-arnold> the patch I saw looked like it introduced a memory leak

criterions.comment: zoneminder package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.32.3-2').
